===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/taumorokoɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/tɔːmorokoɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/toːmorokoɕi/}}

Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=とうもろこし|唐|tr1=tō|t1=Tang Dynasty; China in general; {{qualifier|by extension}} foreign|蜀黍}} or {{m|ja|唐黍|tr=morokoshi||sorghum}},<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> from the visual similarities between the sorghum and maize plants.

The spelling is from {{etyl|zh|ja|sort=とうもろこし}},<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> and appears to be a compound of {{m|zh|玉||jade, jewel}} + {{m|zh|蜀黍|lit=Shu millet||sorghum}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{zh-l|玉蜀黍|tr=yùshǔshǔ|maize}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|トウモロコシ|acc=3|acc_ref=DJR}}

# [[maize]], [[corn]] {{qualifier|especially [[corn on the cob]]}}

=====Usage notes=====
For loose-[[kernel]] [[corn]], the more common term in Japanese is {{ja-r|コーン}}.
